elements.name: Name dem Aufgaben
elements.title: Decide whether the statements are politically left-wing or right-wing.

elements.name: Grundkonflikt: Ausgebauter Sozialstaat vs. restriktive Finanzpolitik
rows: Social welfare in Switzerland should be cut without replacement.
Young unemployed people should receive more support from the state.
Young unemployed people should receive less support from the state.
Health insurance premiums should be paid by every private individual without state support.
Rich people in Switzerland pay more tax than poor people. This difference should be increased.
Rich people in Switzerland pay more taxes than poor people. This difference should be reduced.
Anyone who has been unemployed in the Zurich region for a long time receives around CHF 2600 from social welfare. This amount should be increased.
Anyone who has been unemployed in the Zurich region for a long time receives around CHF 2600 from social welfare. This amount should be reduced.
The state should abolish social welfare and instead pay every adult living here (whether with or without a job) a basic income of CHF 2000.
In future, the state should pay health insurance premiums from tax revenues (instead of everyone paying them out of their own pocket). Taxes would have to be increased to achieve this.
elements.title: Basic conflict: expanded welfare state vs. restrictive fiscal policy

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Decide whether the statements are politically left-wing or right-wing.

elements.name: Grundkonflikt 2: Liberale Gesellschaft vs. Law & Order
rows: Homosexuals should be able to marry.
Homosexuals should not be able to marry.
For example, the state should ban headgear with religious symbolism.
The state should ban abortions in order to protect unborn life.
Smoking weed is harmful to health, so the state should punish it.
Women and couples should be able to decide for themselves whether to terminate a pregnancy.
Every adult should be allowed to decide for themselves whether they want to smoke weed or not.
Despite terrorism, the state should keep surveillance (internet, public space, etc.) to a minimum.
The state should increase surveillance everywhere (Internet, public spaces, etc.) for our own security.
Everyone should be allowed to decide for themselves how they dress and whether they want to wear headgear with religious symbolism, for example
elements.title: Basic conflict: Liberal society vs. law & order

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Decide whether the statements are politically left-wing or right-wing.

elements.name: Grundkonflikt 3: Ausgebauter Umweltschutz vs. Liberale Wirtschaftspolitik
rows: Mopeds with gasoline engines should be banned.
Plastic cutlery should be banned in favor of environmental protection.
Driving is already so expensive that gasoline taxes should be lowered.
I should be able to decide for myself how much and what kind of waste I produce.
State-owned companies such as Swiss Post or SBB should not be privatized under any circumstances.
Aviation and car fuel should be taxed (made more expensive) to protect the environment.
More post offices in Switzerland should be closed because we no longer need many of them.
State-owned companies would offer their services much more cheaply if they were privatized.
I should be able to decide for myself how many mopeds/cars/trains I want to drive or how many airplane kilometers I want to fly.
Post offices are important for village life and for older people. No more post offices should therefore be closed in Switzerland.
elements.title: Basic conflict: Extended environmental protection vs. liberal economic policy

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: Decide whether the statements are politically left-wing or right-wing.

elements.name: Grundkonflikt 4: Offene Aussenpolitik vs. Restriktive Migrationspolitik
rows: Switzerland should help refugees less than it has done so far.
Switzerland should do more to help refugees than it has so far.
The bottom line is that globalization is a negative development for Switzerland.
On balance, globalization is a positive development for Switzerland.
Switzerland's accession to the EU would be disadvantageous for Switzerland on balance.
Switzerland's accession to the EU would be advantageous for Switzerland on balance.
The Bilateral Agreements with the EU are disadvantageous for Switzerland on balance.
On balance, the bilateral agreements with the EU are advantageous for Switzerland.
One of Switzerland's strengths is that people of different nationalities live here.
One of Switzerland's weaknesses is that people of different nationalities live here.
elements.title: Basic conflict: Open foreign policy vs. restrictive migration policy
